titlestmt.titleproper: William Patton White papers, Inclusive: 1861-1864, 1879, undated, Bulk: 1861-1864

note.p: Â© 2021 The Texas Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Papers Summary
did.abstract: The William Patton White papers contains transcripts and copies of Civil War correspondence about personal and military matters.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: William Patton White was born in 1834 and lived near Gainesville, Alabama. He and his wife, Mary J. White, were the parents of three children. During the American Civil War he was a private in Company A of the 36th Alabama Infantry. White is believed to have died in 1864 December from a wound he received at the Battle of Missionary Ridge.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The William Patton White Papers consist primarily of letters written by White during his Civil War military encampments to his wife, Mary J. White, and other family members. His letters are descriptive of military life during good and bad times and are often critical of the hierarchy in the camp. He relates his hospital and sick leave experiences, provides information on military encounters and on his fellow soldiers, and gives his opinion of the war. The collection also contains a small group of letters replying to Mrs. White's inquiries about her husband's death.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The William Patton White papers are arranged chronologically in seven folders. There is currently one series: I. Correspondence.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: William Patton White papers, Accession #86, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor, University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Paul T. Fisher. Released on 2020-02-03.

relatedmaterial.head: Related references
relatedmaterial.bibref: The American Civil War Research Database. "Soldier Data: William L. White." Alexander Street Press, LLC. Accessed on 2020 January 27.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains various letters written from William Patton White primarily to his wife Mary White in Alabama. There are a few letters at the end of the series describing White's whereabouts, presumably because his wife Mary White had heard he had passed away, but was not sure of the details. This series is in excellent condition.
